concept.title: Warnings Library

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH

sl.sli: All safety information in this document must be read, understood and followed.
Only qualified personnel are allowed to install, operate and perform maintenance on the system.
Hazardous voltages are present as soon as the cabinet door is opened. Only qualified electrical personnel are allowed to open the cabinet.
Isolate all power supplies (including the battery) before working on or inside the system.
Always use appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE).
Reinstall all parts and covers, and close the doors before turning on any AC power supply or connecting a DC power source to the system.
Follow safe electrical work practices. See NFPA 70E or CSA Z462.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH

howtoavoid.ph: Always wait 5 minutes after turning off the system and isolating all the power supplies (including the battery). The system contains DC capacitors with long discharge time.

messagepanel.howtoavoid: The system must be connected to protective earth. Always connect the system to protective earth before connecting any power supply.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH

sl.sli: Battery circuit breakers must be installed according to the specifications in the Manufacturing Record Book.
Battery maintenance must only be performed by qualified personnel knowledgeable of batteries and the required precautions.
Always disconnect the charge source before you connect or disconnect the battery to the terminals.
Never open, alter or damage batteries. This can release toxic electrolytes that are harmful to the skin and eyes.
Never dispose of batteries in a fire as they can explode.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH

sl.sli: Never drill or cut holes for cables or conduits with the gland plates installed.
Never drill or cut holes near the system.

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Fire inside the system can produce hazardous vapors that should not be inhaled.

p.note: Only use fire extinguishers with CO2 to put out fires in or close to the systems.

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Never connect the system output to regenerative loads, for example, photovoltaic systems or speed drives.

If the load is not automatically disconnected when the low DC shutdown signal is activated, the connection between the battery bank and the load must be manual opened to avoid permanent damage to the batteries.
Always be aware of the space requirements around the system for ventilation and operation.
Never cover the Reality’s ventilation openings when the system is in operation.
Always dispose of any waste in accordance with local regulations and rules.

This is a Reality category C3 according to IEC 62040-2. This is a Reality for commercial and industrial applications in the second environment - installation restrictions or additional measures may be needed to prevent disturbances. The second environment includes all commercial, light industry, and industrial locations other than residential, commercial, and light industrial premises directly connected without intermediate transformer to a public low-voltage mains supply. The installation and cabling must follow the electromagnetic compatibility rules, e.g.: the segregation of cables, the use of shielded or special cables when relevant, the use of grounded metallic cable tray and supports.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH

howtoavoid.ph: Before performing any maintenance inside the system:

sl.sli: Read the safety information
Use appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE)
Isolate all the power supplies (including the battery) from the system and use lockout-tagout (LOTO)
Wait 5 minutes after isolating the system to let the DC capacitors discharge
Check that any removable (NC) earth link is closed
Check that the parts, capacitors, terminal and protective earth are volt free with a properly rated voltage sensing device
Check that protective covers are installed on any energized parts

p.note: Only open the removable earth link when troubleshooting an earth fault.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH
messagepanel.howtoavoid: Always use isolated tools when removing the protection covers inside the cabinet (metal sheets and plastic covers).
Never perform maintenance on the system alone. While working on systems with hazardous voltages always have a second person close in case of emergency.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH

howtoavoid.ph: When working on batteries always use:

sl.sli: Eye protection
Protective rubber gloves
Protective rubber apron
Protective rubber boots
Insulated tools

sli.ph: Always remove from earth if inadvertently earthed
Always remove watches, rings, or other metal objects
Never place tools or metal objects on top of batteries

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH
messagepanel.howtoavoid: When replacing batteries, always replace with the same type and number of batteries or battery packs.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH

sl.sli: Read all instructions in the Installation Manual before installing or working on the system.
Only install the system after all construction work has been completed and the installation location has been cleaned.

The system must be installed according to the specifications and requirements as defined by Schneider Electric. It concerns in particular the external and internal protections (upstream breakers, battery breakers, cabling, etc.) and environmental requirements. No responsibility is assumed by Schneider Electric if these requirements are not respected.
After the system has been electrically wired, do not start up the system. Start-up must only be performed by Schneider Electric.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH
messagepanel.howtoavoid: The system must be installed according to local and national regulations. Install the system according to: IEC 60364 (including 60364–4–41- protection against electric shock, 60364– 4–42 - protection against thermal effect, and 60364–4–43 - protection against overcurrent), or NEC NFPA 70, or Canadian Electrical Code (C22.1, Part 1) depending on which one of the standards apply in your local area.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH
messagepanel.howtoavoid: In systems without internal backfeed protection, the bypass mains supply connection must be provided with a suitable isolator of the type MCCB by the customer, according to IEC/EN 60947–2 or UL 489/CSA C22.2 No. 5 (depending on which apply to your local area).

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH

sl.sli: In a restricted access area
In an indoor environment that is temperature controlled, free of conductive contaminants and humidity
Directly on a leveled, solid and non-combustible surface that can support the weight of the system

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH
messagepanel.howtoavoid: The system is not designed for and must not be installed in the following unusual operating environments: Damaging fumes Explosive mixtures of dust or gases, corrosive gases, or conductive or radiant heat from other sources Moisture, abrasive dust, steam or in an excessively damp environment Fungus, insects, vermin Salt-laden air or contaminated cooling refrigerant Pollution degree higher than 2 according to IEC 60664-1 Exposure to abnormal vibrations, shocks, and tilting Exposure to direct sunlight, heat sources, or strong electromagnetic fields
Never make mechanical changes to the system, including removal of cabinet parts or drilling/cutting of holes that are not described in the Installation Manual.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: loss of load sharing and output voltage
messagepanel.howtoavoid: For parallel systems with three or more units always use power cables of equal resistance, equal length and equal size for the same function on each unit.
If the system remains de-energized for a long period, it is recommended that you energize the system for a period of 24 hours at least once every month to avoid irreversible damage to the batteries.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH

sli.ph: Always wait 5 minutes after turning off the system. The system contains DC capacitors with long discharge time.

sl.sli: Hazardous voltages are still present at some circuits, terminals and switches even when the system is turned off.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH

sli.ph: Always wait 5 minutes after turning off the system. The system contains DC capacitors with long discharge time.

sl.sli: Hazardous voltages are still present at some circuits, terminals and switches even when the system is turned off.
Only one unit is isolated. The other unit and any bypass common battery or distribution cabinet are still energized.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH

sli.ph: Always wait 5 minutes after turning off the system. The system contains DC capacitors with long discharge time.

sl.sli: Hazardous voltages are still present at some circuits, terminals and switches when the manual bypass switch is in bypass position.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH
messagepanel.howtoavoid: The system is not volt free in bypass operation. The load is supplied from the bypass mains via the system and the static switch EN.
Before working on this circuit: Isolate the uninterruptible power supply (UPS) System Check for hazardous voltage between all terminals, including the protective earth

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH
messagepanel.howtoavoid: Isolate the bypass section. Check with a properly rated voltage sensing device that the bypass section is volt free.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH
messagepanel.howtoavoid: Never attempt to install a damaged system.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH
messagepanel.howtoavoid: The open output terminal (or open output isolator switch, depending on configuration) is energized after the bypass breakers and switches are closed.
Make sure the load is kept volt free until the commissioning is complete. Only energize the load after approval by responsible personnel.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH
messagepanel.howtoavoid: Keep the feeders or breakers in the distribution open if there is no downstream breaker that keeps the load volt free. Only energize the load after approval by responsible personnel.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION, OR ARC FLASH

sl.sli: Only qualified personnel are allowed to troubleshoot and perform corrective actions on the system.
Hazardous voltages are present as soon as the cabinet door is opened. Only qualified electrical personnel are allowed to open the cabinet.
Always use appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE).

messagepanel.howtoavoid: When transporting the crate always pay attention to the placement of the center of gravity markings.

Never install a system with moisture inside the cabinet, it can create hazardous short circuits. To protect the system from moisture: Only unpack the system just before installation. Always unpack the system in a clean and dry environment.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: unintended lifting or transportation of Heavy Object

sl.sli: Always follow the lifting and transportation instructions in the Installation Manual, do not transport or lift the system in any other way.
Separate the system into its transport units and move each transport unit separately.
Make sure all lifting and transportation equipment used is rated for the weight of the transport unit.
Always pay attention to the center of gravity of the transport unit.
Only use lifting equipment rated for the weight of the transport unit.
Remove the rain roof (for systems with an IP rating of IPx1 or higher).
All locations for the lifting eye nuts must be used.
The lifting eye nuts must be tightened so that the flange of the lifting eye nut is in contact with the roof plate (or nuts).
For transport units heavier than 500 kg the lifting lugs must be strained perpendicularly.
Only use forklifts and pallet trucks rated for the weight of the transport unit.
Always remove all bottom mounted ventilation grids (front, back and bottom), filter mats and gland plates before transportation.
Always make sure that the center of gravity is as close to the middle of the forks as possible.
Always make sure the frame of the system rests completely on the forks.

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Make sure the system is completely dry before commissioning. Moisture inside the cabinet can create hazardous short circuits. If the system is not completely dry, for example if there is any condensed water, let the system stand with cabinet doors open in a dry, warm and clean area for at least 24h.
Only connect the battery bank when the rectifier is in operation. The DC capacitors needs to be charged by the rectifier output before the battery is connected.
Always charge the DC capacitors before closing the inverter input switch.
Never actuate the manual bypass switches when the system is in normal operation. Only switch to manual bypass from bypass operation.
Only operate breakers and switches according to instruction in the Operation Manual.
Before connecting any test load, check the size of the main fuse at the bypass mains input.

Some packaging options use volatile corrosion inhibitor (VCI). When in contact with VCI: Make sure the area is well ventilated. Always use protective gloves when handling VCI materials. Do not eat, drink or smoke nearby. Always wash your hands and exposed skin after handling VCI materials.

Before commissioning make sure that you: Have read and understood the complete commissioning procedure. Know the system and its configuration. Have studied the Single Line Diagram. Know the location of all switches, breakers and feeders described in the procedure.
Never earth batteries if the system is not designed accordingly.
Make sure that the neutral current does not exceed the rated ampacity of the conductor.

When the manual bypass switch is in Test or Bypass position, there is no backup from the battery it is not possible for the system to automatically switch back to inverter operation in case the bypass mains becomes unavailable.
If the system is turned off without the manual bypass in Test or Bypass the output voltage is lost.
When the units in a redundant system are separated the redundancy of the output is lost.
When the units in a redundant system are separated the redundancy of the output is lost.
Always coordinate maintenance and turning off or on the system with the users of the consumers. Make sure that users of the connected consumers are informed before proceeding.
After a battery capacity test the batteries are discharged and it may take up to 24 hours to fully recharge them again.
Make sure to coordinate and schedule the test with the responsible personnel and users of the connected consumers.

The replacement cycles in the replacement schedules assume normal operation and can be different depending on multiple conditions. For example: The replacement cycles are based on a maximum ambient temperature of 40°C (104°F) and a maximum load of 70%. If any of the maximum values is continuously exceeded, the parts must be replaced 1 year earlier. The replacement cycles can be shorter and the scope extended if the system is exposed to harsh environmental conditions, for example, to vibration, harsh climate, chemicals or air-pollution.
Be careful when unpacking the system that none of the packages or bags with parts for installation are thrown away.

To ensure that the packing material protects the system: Open the protective packing just before installation. If opened for inspection, re-seal the packing material quickly and to the initial condition. Make sure the packing material does not get any scratches or cuts.
Only install the rain roofs, ventilation grids, filter mats or gland plates when the transport units are transported to the final installation location.
If the battery solution is not included in the system solution, Schneider Electric and Reality does not take any responsibility for installation or connection of the battery solution.
If a DC UPS system is used to supply the inverter system, make sure the DC UPS system is commissioned and operates correctly without any alarms before commissioning the inverter system.
Always disconnect the load from the output when using initial charge mode. The DC voltage is higher than in boost or float charge.
